definitions.definition: The opening of a creature through which food is ingested.
definitions.example: "Open your mouth and say 'aah'," directed the doctor.

definitions.definition: The end of a river out of which water flows into a sea or other large body of water.
definitions.example: The mouth of the river is a good place to go birdwatching in spring and autumn.

definitions.definition: A loud or overly talkative person.
definitions.example: My kid sister is a real mouth; she never shuts up.

definitions.definition: (saddlery) The crosspiece of a bridle bit, which enters the mouth of an animal.
A principal speaker; one who utters the common opinion; a mouthpiece.
A wry face; a grimace; a mow.

definitions.example: He mouthed his opinions on the subject at the meeting.

definitions.definition: To make the actions of speech, without producing sound.
definitions.example: The prompter mouthed the words to the actor, who had forgotten them.

definitions.definition: To utter with a voice that is overly loud or swelling.
To pick up or handle with the lips or mouth, but not chew or swallow.
definitions.example: The fish mouthed the lure, but didn't bite.

definitions.definition: To take into the mouth; to seize or grind with the mouth or teeth; to chew; to devour.
To form or cleanse with the mouth; to lick, as a bear licks her cub.
